questions.name: school
questions.text: What is the highest level of school you have completed or the highest degree you have received?
answers: High school graduate or GED (includes technical/vocational training that doesn’t towards college credit)
Some college (some community college, associate’s degree)
Some postgraduate or professional schooling, no postgraduate degree
Postgraduate or professional degree, including master’s, doctorate, medical or law degree

questions.name: taxes
questions.text: Last year what was your total family income from all sources, before taxes?

questions.text: Should the U.S. build a wall along the southern border?

questions.name: environment
questions.text: Should the government increase environmental regulations to prevent climate change?

questions.name: farmers
questions.text: If three farmers can plant three trees in three hours, how long would it take nine farmers to plant nine trees?

questions.name: marks
questions.text: Sean received both the 5th highest and the 5th lowest mark in the class. How many students are there in the class?

questions.name: athletics
questions.text: In an athletics team, females are four times more likely to win a medal than males. This year the team has won 20 medals so far. How many of these have been won by males?
